The relationship is a modified Arrhenius-like phenomenological model to describe the pressure-induced changes in the optical response. While a = τ r/τ nr relates to the competition between nonradiative and radiative recombination channels at infinitely great pressure, λ, with the units of pressure, can approximately evaluate the transition from semiconductor (radiative)– to metal (nonradiative)–like behavior. By fitting α 0 versus pressure, we obtain a = (4.37 ± 1.12) × 10 6 and λ = (53.7 ± 8.2) GPa. The value of λ is in the typical pressure range where the metalization takes place for halide perovskite (
21 ). Using the parameters, we can obtain the relative quantum yield of (PEA) 2PbI 4 (η r) under the applied pressure. Since quantum yield η is proportional to the PL intensity coefficient α, we have the relationship between relative (η r) and initial zero-pressure quantum yield (η 0): η r = η/η 0 = α/α 0. Hence, the pressure dependence of relative quantum yield is η r = 1/(1 + ae −λ/ P ).
